Column Comment.0: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: the unique identifier for the business associate.
Column Comment.1: PREFERENCE TYPE: The type of preference documented, such as preference formeeting times, well log curve selection, parameter useage etc.
Column Comment.2: PREFERENCE OBS NO: unique identifier for the specific preference for thisbusiness associate and preference type.
Column Comment.3: LEVEL IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for this level in the preference.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: PREFERRED CURRENCY: Indicates for the business associate, the type ofcurrency preferred for this type of transaction. Note that different preferences can beset for various types of transactions.
Column Comment.6: DESCRIPTION: text description of the level of this preference, could be explanitoryremarks, locations etc.
Column Comment.7: EFFECTIVE DATE: date on which the data in this row came into effect.
Column Comment.8: EXPIRY DATE: Date on which the data in this row of data was no longer in effect.
Column Comment.9: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.10: PREFERENCE LEVEL: Use this column to order each preference from first to last.For each preference type, more than one entry may share the same preference level;this implies that these are equally preferred.
Column Comment.11: PREFERENCE RULE: where preferences may be rule based, the rule or a call to aprocedure that manages the rule may be placed in this column.
Column Comment.12: PREFERRED BUSINESS ASSOCIATE IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for a businessassociate who is preferred for some service or performing some function.
Column Comment.13: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.14: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.15: WELL LOG DICTIONARY: The dictionary contains a set of curve names, propertynames and parameters that are used by a well logging contracter during a specifiedperiod of time. At any given time, a contractor may have one or more dictionaries inuse.
Column Comment.16: CURVE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the curve that has been defined in thisdictionary.
Column Comment.17: WELL LOG PARAMETER IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the parameter that isfound in the dictionary.
Column Comment.18: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.19: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.20: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.21: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.22: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.23: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.24: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
